result.title: Need Idea on this problem -> Median Differences
result.content:
Sorry Guys! I don't have a link to the problem as it was asked in a private contest and I cant find it.

Problem statement goes like this,

Let A be a array of n elements , find the median of the array that is formed by differences of elements in A , our differences Array will have (n*(n-1)/2) elements.

Constraints : n — [1,200000] A[i] — [1,10^9]

My approach (Incomplete) :

  1. sort A.
  2. Let D be the array that is formed by finding differences between consecutive elements i.e A[i+1] — A[i] (after sorting).
  3. Now all the possible differences are sum of elements in some subset of D , of which we have to find the
    ((n*(n-1))/4)th largest difference.

  4. That's it ... I am stuck with the previous step ...

Help me to proceed after this , Or if my direction of approach is not correct , Or some other solution for the problem.
